qas.question: What kind of cancer cells may zinc prove to kill?
What type of agent is zync useful as against prostate cancer?
What could overuse of zinc possibly cause?
Where does zinc naturally buildup in the body?
What kind of cancer cells may zinc prove to heal?
What type of agent is zinc useless as against prostate cancer?

Where does zinc mysteriously buildup in the body?

context: Although not yet tested as a therapy in humans, a growing body of evidence indicates that zinc may preferentially kill <a0_0><b4_0><b6_0>prostate<b4_0/><a0_0/> cancer<b6_0/> cells. Because zinc naturally homes to the prostate and because the prostate is accessible with relatively non-invasive procedures, its potential as a <a1_0><b5_0>chemotherapeutic<b5_0/><a1_0/> agent in this type of cancer has shown promise. However, other studies have demonstrated that chronic use of zinc supplements in excess of the recommended dosage may actually increase the chance of developing <a2_0><b7_0>prostate<b7_0/> cancer<a2_0/>, also likely due to the natural buildup of this heavy metal in the <a3_0>prostate.
